channel.title: Ggplot2 on Ada Lovelace
channel.description: Recent content in Ggplot2 on Ada Lovelace

item.title: my take a sad plot and make it better- Uno
item.description: library(tidyverse) library(viridis) # colors! library(beyonce) # colors!! library(extrafont) # fonts! ratings <- read_csv("http://bit.ly/cs631-ratings", na = c("", "NA", "N/A"), col_types = cols( viewers_7day = col_number(), series = col_factor(levels = NULL) )) # some small wrangling ratings_bonanza1 <- ratings %>% mutate(ep_id = row_number(), series = as.factor(series)) %>% select(ep_id, viewers_7day, series) # my colors from beyonce mybey <- beyonce_palette(66)[c(11,10,7,6,5,4,3,1)] # make the plot ggplot(ratings_bonanza1, aes(x = ep_id, y = viewers_7day, fill = series)) + geom_col(alpha = .
